Reviews.Content: We absolutely were pleased with our room. We had the Classic Room. (Gold) Bathroom- The cleanest, spacious, with stand up shower, fan and nice window and hair dryer was a plus. Bedroom- LOVED LOVED LOVED the bed! I booked this room because of their beds and cleanliness. I don't stay in hotels with hard smelly beds.. This bed was so comfortable that we had the best sleep EVER! Loved the decor and colors- i took pictures of the bed, i loved the headboard!!! Nice big windows- air the room out!! Overall the room- Smelled good, clean, enough room for two, comfortable clean beds, free WIFI with code at front desk- has anything you need! Free breakfast! Proximity to Rialto, Train- We WALKED everywhere!! It is close to everything. About 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. It is very close to the train but we had to take a water taxi to our hotel. That was the only time we took public transportation. Breakfast- European breakfast. We had a few pastries and cappuccino. We ate cereal and fruit. Save the calories for dinner!!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: distolz
Reviews.Content: Booked after reading Tripadvisor reviews. This hotel has the "wow" factor. It is beautifully decorated and is immaculately clean. The location is so quiet that a good night's sleep is easy . Staff were very warm and welcoming. Our deal had free internet and breakfast - excellent. We were not at all surprised to see the Tripadvisor award on the reception desk. The hotel has not been opened long, but they could give lessons to some on the meaning of "hospitality". We caught the Alilaguna ferry from the airport to "Guglie". We did not see one Traghetto the whole time we were there - there is a crossing near the hotel. For this reason we walked from the ferry stop. When we arrived at the Scalzi bridge (near the railway station) we just had to follow the mustard coloured signs painted high on the walls to the hotel. The first we saw when were atop the Scalzi bridge - look at the wall in front of you and the sign is to the right of the street. Follow the arrows to MUSEU CIVICO di STORIA, Fontego dei Turchi and you will find yourself at the hotel. Look for the red banner. Once there, you will not be disappointed. Congratulations to everyone at the hotel for making our stay in magnificent Venice so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel. What's not to love about it!”
Reviews.Author: SemiMonty
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was brilliant. I loved this hotel. It's the perfect place for a romantic getaway. The room, esp. the red superior room was stupendous. I will go back there for sure. P.S - If you're loaded, then go by the hotel staff's recommendations for places to eat, visit, etc. If you're not, then do your own homework cause their recommendations all but drove me to poverty :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to perfect!”
Reviews.Author: josii11
Reviews.Content: We (my husband & I) stayed at the Hotel Al Duca di Venezia for one night in May whilst on our honeymoon. As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted by a very friendly lady who quickly checked us in and personally escorted us to our room. Our room was the only one that did not have an ensuite bathroom which was not a problem for us - the bathroom was up a short flight of stairs and we were the only people using it. The room itself was huge with a lovely big comfortable bed, high quality linen and comfortable, elegant furniture. Ours had a cream colour scheme though others in the hotel we noticed had extravagent deep red carpets and wall paper. There was a wardrobe and an in-room safe which was a bonus to be able to lock passports away safely. The external bathroom was also very large with a wonderful strong and roomy shower and we appreciated the quality soaps and shampoos. Everything in both rooms was spotlessly clean except we noticed a few stains on the couch which was a shame to spoil such gorgeous furniture. Free wi-fi was very handy too - a password needs to be obtained from reception. Venice can be quite a difficult city to navigate however we were able to find the hotel with minimal difficulty even without a detailed map. It took us about 15 minutes walking from the train station but you can also get a boat if you do not want to (or are unable to) carry your luggage up and down many stairs as you walk across several bridges. We were able to open the windows to our room completely so we could see down into the street below so nice to have a view of Venice. The hotel is close to a school so we could hear children playing but it was otherwise very quiet and relaxing and we slept incredibly well. We felt more like we were in the real Venice rather than with all the other tourists on the Grand Canal which we loved. The breakfast the next morning was enjoyable with a range of breads, pastries, fruit, juice, coffee etc. It was perfect to get us started for another day of travelling especially after such a great sleep! Overall we thought the hotel was definitely value for money compared to other hotels of similar quality in Venice which is an expensive city. The service and quality of the room for the price was better than most other places we have stayed during this particular trip in Europe and others we have taken before. Would highly recommend the hotel to anyone - worth splurging a little to get such great service and quality accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all departments - AND in a city of very expensive hotels it is very good value”
Reviews.Author: gloandbob
Reviews.Content: There is very little more to say about this excellent hotel that has not been said in the last few TA reviews. We like many others booked not only on those reviews, but also due to location, being close to two Vaporetto stops, and only a comfortable stroll to the station and the major sights of Rialto and St Mark's. The close by restaurants, a reasonable size supermarket (and a great ice cream shop), and a relaxing Campo all added to the experience. Finally, and certainly not least, the staff. All four front desk staff we met during our four night stay were efficient and helpul. I say all four, as I am assuming that Carlo did not have a twin brother as he seemed to be in attendance nearly all the time. I liked his comment that they recommend coming from the Riva de Biasio stop as there is only one, not two, bridges to cross to get to the hotel. We have visited Venice 5 times now and each time had a carefully chosen hotel, all for different reasons, but for our sixth visit we will come back to Al Duca

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Quiet Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: perrubud
Reviews.Content: Lovely, quiet hotel in (slightly) less touristy area of the city. Front desk was accommodating at all times. Breakfast was very good and generous. Despite the fact we were on a ground floor room, I slept like a baby and felt very secure. For older travellers getting to other parts of the city may be a bit arduous; we were fine with taking the public boats, for which we bought a three day pass, very much needed. All in all, a positive experience in a city overrun by tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Red Rooms were quite the hit for our family...”
Reviews.Author: Griswalds007
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be a 15 minute walk from the Rialto, and another 10 minutes from St Mark's Square, but our family found its location to be one of this hotel's attractive features. In a city of chaos with many tourists, the hotel's location was perfect, away from the brouhaha of the crowds of tourists, but close to some very quaint piazzas with great restaurant selections. We had a royal red room which my wife was very excited about, as was our niece who stayed in another equally red room with her family!! The rooms were very elegant, and even had air conditioning. There was a communal room on the 1st floor with a small balcony. Our family (almost 12 of us, plus 2 close friends) all stayed in the hotel, and enjoyed some pre and post-dinner drinks in this elegant communal room. It was ideal for our situation. The hotel was fairly difficult to find but what isnt in Venice unless you're looking for the Rialto or St Mark's.... We would definitely stay here again. Carlo on the front desk was extremely helpful and accomodating. No cash discounts offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venetian style and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: suehax
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Hotel Al Duca di Venezia with my husband and two teenage sons. We loved the hotel -- from the over-the-top Venetian style decor (very dramatic!) to the lovely and accommodating host. The location is a few steps off the Grand Canal right near the Natural History Museum. It is off the tourist-heavy path and we loved it for that. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and another 5 to San Marco, both of which were loaded down with people during Easter Week. The more quiet neighborhood of the hotel was a wonderful treat after spending the days with the throngs of other tourists. There are still plenty of lovely piazzas and restaurants close by. An added plus is that it is a quick walk to the train station if you are arriving or leaving the city that way. We had the family room which featured a king and a king pull-out which my children said was very comfortable. The only issue we had was a rather smallish bathroom with only a half shower door. With teenage boys in tow, the floor of the bathroom would get quite wet. Otherwise, fantastic and a great choice for families, but also very beautiful with lots of murano glass chandeliers, so quite romantic as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanson
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TA and we and our travel friends were thrilled with my choice! Pretty rooms, friendly staff who made us dinner reservations at fantastic restaurants, and overall a pleasant experience. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Traverler8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel purely on TA reviews. We were not disappointed. Warm welcome, room was big and comfortable. Location was perfect, quiet but can explore main attractions by walking. We will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KeithMcCawley
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean. Efficient service. Terrific breakfast. Awesome bathroom. Damask upholstered walls are luxurious and insulating. Close to train and an easy boat ride to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Aggierr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights in venice . The hotel was so good I had to share it . Beautiful clean rooms venetian Decore . The staff were really friendly and helpful with all our requests . The local area is fabulous with great food and drinks just yards away . Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont want to stay near to canal, it's good!”
Reviews.Author: ecealtan
Reviews.Content: you can find the hotel easily, not very near to San Marco but hotel, room, furnitures are good. breakfast is not bad, not very good.

Reviews.Title: “We strong recommend Al Duca Di Venezia hotel for you next trip to Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: LuccaUK
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I had an amazing time!! The service was very good!! The manager, Catherina was very nice and helpful. We stayed in a room with external bathroom but it was not a problem at all!! We strong recommend Al Duca Di Venezia hotel for you next trip to Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a peaceful location.”
Reviews.Author: Kristine_Tim
Reviews.Content: As pictured on the internet, the "red room" is a true indication of spaciousness. Huge and luxurious bedroom and bathroom (both very clean), with deep bath and good water pressure on the shower! Room bright when needed, and dark when necessary. Quiet location, away from the hustle and bustle. Easy to find as it is next to the Natural History Museum. Vaporetto stop on Riva di Biasio approximately 250m from hotel and only one stop from Ferrovia train station. Majer bakery on Calle Larga 100m from hotel - cheap, delicious food, friendly staff. La Zucca, scrumptious vegetarian food approximately 100m from hotel. Fair distance from major sights, though vaporetti are useful for getting around. Breakfast not served until 8am, which is not helpful if you would like an early start to your sightseeing day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and Hotel in Quiet Santa Croce”
Reviews.Author: HikingFoolCincinnati
Reviews.Content: An 8 minute walk from the train station (P. Roma) following the "yellow signs" for the Natural History Museum gets you easily to this beautiful 300+ year old hotel. It's small (22 rooms) but elegant. We stayed in the very roomy Gold Tone Superior room with a shower. It had a very comfortable King Bed with a Murano Chandelier and very old wood parquait floors. The bathroom was recently remodelled with new fixtures and marble counters. It was very quiet since it's in the middle of a neighborhood. It's steps away from both a Vaporetto stop and a Traghetto and a 8 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. You can walk anywhere in Venice from this hotel in 30 minutes or less! The breakfasts were good (especially the blood oranges, the prosciutto, and the pastries) . There is a great restaurant that is 1-2 minutes away (La Zucca) and a wonderful little grocery store with good inexpensive wines, gelato, and a great tiramisu for only 2.5 euro (It's called Majer). Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better!”
Reviews.Author: chouky50
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull hotel,quiet located,near vaporetto and ideal to explore Venice.Hotel management very nice and helpfull..Delicious breakfast,quiet,nice rooms.Nice restaurants in the neighbourhood. We surely return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laughable
Reviews.Content: Travelled to the Al Duca in Venice to surprise a friend for his 40th birthday. Lovely hotel, if some what hard to find! Elegant lobby, spacious rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast OK but not a great selection compared to other Italian hotels I have stayed in Rome, Milan and Florence. Restaurants and bars nearby are lovely, especially the Al Prosecco bar - where there was impromptu Argentine Tango dancing in the square - magical! Went to Harry's bar for a treat - don't bother unless you have deep pockets!!! There are much nicer places to sip a Bellini I can assure you....All in all Venice is a dream......

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend..”
Reviews.Author: itshitchhiker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. We reached Venice train station late in the night and decided to walk to the hotel. But even with a very detailed map, we had some trouble finding the location. The guy at the reception was pretty friendly and suggested many must-see places in the area and even took the pains to mark them on the map. The room was nice (even had a small provision for skylight). It is also equipped with all required amenities. Internet is also available in the room. The breakfast was very basic but filling. One has to walk some distance to get to the main centres. But overall, i give a thumbs-up!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sjcotton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a romantic break with my boyfriend, we got upgraded to a superior room which was huge all decked out in red drapes and gold mirrors. Staff very really friendly and helpful and had the best nights sleep in ages. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, luxurious and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeMike
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation 6 months in advance, based on the TA reviews, and are glad we did. The hotel is new/newly renovated, with beautiful decor, marble bathrooms, elegant linens and Venetian chandeliers in all of the rooms. The location was excellent for us - near a vaporetto stop and the train station, in a quiet area of Santa Croce not too near the San Marco tourist mayhem. The hotel staff accommodated without a fuss a special request we made (our daughters weren't comfortable sleeping in the same king size bed, so the hotel re-made the bed as two single beds). We arrived at the hotel before check-in time, but they held our bags and had moved them to our room by the time we returned from a walk in Venice. The free wifi worked great in our 2nd floor (European 1st floor) room. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking an elegant stay and attentive service in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel of a hotel in a unique city full of enchanting sights, sounds and places to see.”
Reviews.Author: Alan_100_100
Reviews.Content: This small, friendly and beautifully appointed hotel proved to be a marvellous base for a relaxing long weekend of fun, great food and hours and hours of incredible sightseeing in the magical city of Venice! Situated almost on the banks of the Grand Canal adjacent to the National History Museum (follow the signs if youever feel lost) this 22 room hotel is really special. The service at the hotel Reception Desk and in the breakfast room is polite, professional, knowlegeable and friendly at all times. The bedrooms are spotlessly clean, spacious and elegantly furnished - even to the extent of having fine glass chandeliers. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bramble2103
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be 5 star. It made our trip all the more special... The decor and cleanliness of the room was excellent and the staff were extremely friendly. They couldnt do enough for you.. The breakfast was very nice, even though there wasn't a huge selection, there was enough choice to suit everyone. I would definatly recommend this hotel, and if I were to go back to venice would definatly stay here. Added extras were that they provided you with a detailed map on your arrival, pointing out all the must see places, recommended resturants (although we didn't try them) and there is free internet access in the hotel with a pass code they provide you with at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality Hotel, very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: audrog
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend and would visit again. Staff definitely went that extra mile for your comfort and enjoyment during your stay, nothing was too much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel as expected”
Reviews.Author: Robertininghilterra
Reviews.Content: We walked to the hotel and found it not far from the P.Di Roma. 20 minutes only. It is a similar distance from Rialto and Santa Croce while quiter than San Marco or Rialto is a lovely area. Hotel was as adequately described by others. Clean as new and the staff very helpful. No problem finding it as you head for Fondaco dei Turchi now a museum and it is in that road so immediately behind the church you come to walking from the direction of P.Di Roma or the vaperetto stop if you are lazy. We had a classic room #302 in the eaves of the roof is the gold/beige room you see on their website with the more ornate bedhead. There was not great headroom in the bath due to the roof beam but the room was large and the marble evident in the bathroom gave it a touch of class. Our neice and nephew were upgraded from to the Superior family room and described it as Buckingham Palace. Room # 102 was the large red room and it was lovely. Nearby we found a great restaurant half way on the main route to Rialto. Called "Muro Venezia" in Campiello Dello Spezier. Closed Tuesdays. Look at their website. Excellent food and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: gillysussexengland
Reviews.Content: spent 3 night there a few days ago. went with a friend for a birthday get away. booked hotel after looking at the reviews and were not disappointed.Slightly off the beaten track but that"s what we liked. As you walk everywhere it really makes no difference anyway and it was quiet and very real venice. 5 mins to station 15 or so to Rialto.Very good bar 1 mins walk away where the locals go and a great trattoria again 1 min. walk with fab. venezian food very well done. I lived in Italy for 20years so I have a pretty good idea. we ate there every night. it"s called La trattoria al ponte. Staff all very helpful all the time and we had tea and coffee in our room - to get us up - for a small charge.Rooms clean comfortable nicely decorated, all new. we were given maps and they helped with directions. I was looking for a paritcular shop and they googled it for me and wrote down the address, all with great friendliness. would tell my friends. Gilly sussex

Reviews.Title: “Book your room. Now.”
Reviews.Author: rgp117
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very quiet part of Venice, about a 15-minute walk from the train station and a 15 to 20 minute walk to Plaza San Marco. We were given a room on the ground floor behind the reception desk. The room had a small window facing the street, and being at ground level, the view was not very good. You may want to inquire if this is the only standard room available. The people working at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Upon check-in, the person at the reception desk gave us a map and really took the time to instruct us on the location of the hotel, how to get to various sites of interest, and how to take the water bus. This guy deserves a pay raise. I can confirm the reviews on this website about the quality of the rooms. Our room was clean and richly decorated. The bathroom is large and for the price, I was pleasantly surprised to find free disposable bath products, unlike other hotels in Europe. The shiny marble tiles add to the aesthetic appeal. For a wonderful stay in lovely Venice, book your room at this cozy hotel now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: myowncanoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights over New Years Eve and had chosen the hotel due to the excellent reviews here. The place was very clean and well appointed, lovely decor in our tiny standard room (the bathroom was huge and very nice). But the service really let it down. When we arrived (early) they were too busy to check us in properly so we were told to leave our bags in the (unsecured) dining room and come back later). No map, no guidance, no attention. Then when we did come back our bags were still downstairs, forgotten about. By this time there was one staff member, a man, who made smarty-pants remarks to everything we said. He was helpful enough, but only after making smarmy comments. When we enquired about wi-fi my husband was told it was only reliable in the small lobby and he was left waiting for half an hour for a password (she'd said to wait and then forgotten that he was over on the couch in plain view, waiting). The bed was very hard (but better than some we'd stayed in like th el cheapo backpackers in Naples). Mr Smarmy did deliver some excellent help at this stage and found me a cot mattress to pad the bed with. The room was very dark with the blinds closed, so much so that we overslept and didn't realise that it was morning when it was (set your alarms). For how the hotel looked and its rating, the breakfast was surprisingly supermarket-ish. Not particularly enticing at all - just supermarket pre-packaged baked goods. Then to top it off as we checked out we watched in amazement as a couple checking in were given a map and detailed directions for getting around and all their service came with a smile and no smarm from Mr Smarmy.

Reviews.Title: “P-E-R-F-E-C-T! More than a 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hotel_savvy_11
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this is one of the top hotels on TripAdvisor - it deserves to be there. We stayed here for 2 nights early January, the first night in a Superior room, the second in the Classic room. Both were nice, but if you can, I would pay the extra and get the more spacious, lavishly decorated Superior room (pictured). Pros: EXCELLENT SERVICE! New, clean and elegantly decorated rooms. Free internet in your room (Ethernet cable provided). Very spacious in the Superior room. The continental breakfast was great - pastries, croissants, cereal, cheese, individual jars of jam ect. Excellent value for money. Cons: The hotel is small so there is no room service but that's about all I can fault. We would like to thank Caterina for being such an accommodating and helpful host. We had such a wonderful stay and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: DavidandSharon
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a couple of days in Venice with my wife, this was our first time there so a bit unsure of where to stay and to be honest looked on Trip Advisor for a bit of inspiration. I have to say we werenâ€™t disappointed, this hotel has got it just right! The place is spotlessly clean and extremely well presented, the hotel staff are friendly and attentive without going overboard and the location is great as is only 10mins walk from the station and The Rialto Bridge and a further 10-15mins to st Marks Square. When we checked in we were given a complimentary map and a 5min talk on where we were and where best to go, as first timers in Venice this was also a real help.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Great hotel. Wonderful staff. Can't go past this one!”
Reviews.Author: laborsia
Reviews.Content: Due to our own stupid mistake, we showed up at this hotel one day before our reservation. The staff were so accomodating. They put us into a spare room (which was amazing) and took great care of us. This hotel is in a great location. It is not right on top of the main tourist haunts so it gives you a chance to explore different lane ways every time you venture out. The breakfasts were great and staff were always on hand to help. We opted to book a room with an external bathroom. This unfortunatley was actually up on another level and through a canvas covered walkway on the roof - which was not the greatest seeing as it was winter, but all in all, we would go back to Al Duca di Venezia if we have the good fortune to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “good value freshly redecorated boutique hotel in quiet and well located positoion”
Reviews.Author: roamers46
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a room for 4. It was cosy but very comfortable in a newly refurbished room. The bathroom was spacious and well accomodated. Staff were friendly. An adequate breakfast was included. The area is quite but only 2 minutes away from a campo with a patisserie, supermarkets and restaurants. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel in this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Traveler216_fl
Reviews.Content: Elegant, warm, excellent service - we were more than pleased with this hotel. The rooms were beautiful (we had a cream and gold decorated room), comfortable bed, excellent bath room, breakfast was lovely, internet in room (LAN not wireless, but it was good service). Please note, the hotel is set approximately 20-30 minutes walk from St. Mark's but that was fine with us! It allowed us to 'wander' the walkways and get a real feel for Venice. Walking to the Rialto and the fish market was a delight. Caterina and her staff are most gracious, very helpful with maps and suggestions. It is approximately 20-25 minutes walk from the train station. Note: we brought our GPS and were grateful for it as when we arrived, we promptly were lost! But it brought us directly to the hotel. If you use a GPS, note that you must set it for walking or stop frequently to update your exact position. Also, if you are walking, keep your luggage to a minimum. There are many many bridges with steps that may prove too daunting for some with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, between a 3.5 and a 4 for me...”
Reviews.Author: Resident_World
Reviews.Content: TICKS: - This hotel was pretty nice. We were given a free upgrade to an outrageously decorated room on arrival which was nice. - Really nice bathroom. - The staff are excellent, really a fantastically friendly bunch of people. - Free internet in hotel lobby. CROSSES: - The breakfast is poor. When you are given breakfast as part of your rate, you expect it to include hot food. Instead, we were disappointed to see we would be required to pay for eggs, etc. - No a/c in the room because it is winter. We had to open our windows to avoid it being too stuffy and hot. Quite an annoyance really as we stayed a few nights. - Location isn't really the best to be honest. I would have much preferred closer to Rialto. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but it is not without some noticeable flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: erinray
Reviews.Content: We were only in Venice to acclimate (flew from Seattle) as our ultimate destiny was Dubrovnik, but we ended up staying three nights to see if our luggage would show up. The staff at Al Duca was very accommodating; they had to move us one night since our initial reservation was one night and we were upgraded for the same price. The hotel itself was lovely, the rooms were a nice size, the shower pressure was great, the heat was respondent, the breakfast was tasty, the hotel was quiet. All in all, a nice experience and aside from the missing luggage, a perfect kick-off to a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Bullying and unfair..”
Reviews.Author: Karzack
Reviews.Content: I had booked 2 nights at this hotel via booking.com, however could not make it to Venice on time due to Italian transportation strike, I informed booking.com about my predicament and rightfuly so changed my booking to only 1 night. As a courtesy I informed the hotel about the change and was told insistingly that I will have to pay the full 2 nights which I believe was unfair so I cancelled my booking altogether via booking.com. I was quite distraught to find out when I was back that the hotel charged me full 2 nights despite me not even having spent 1 night at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Comfortable Rooms, Warm Service”
Reviews.Author: SooW
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly renovated. We had a large family room which comfortably accommodates our family of four. We walked to all the attractions. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Venetian-styled experience!”
Reviews.Author: MRKAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Al Duca Hotel for four nights, and really enjoyed our stay. Location: Although not located in the touristy centre (more relaxed and quiet!), Venice is very small and you can walk from the hotel to all the hotspots in about 10 minutes. Rooms: The hotel is expectionally well build and decorated - I have seldomly seen such eye for detail. The rooms are really 'Venetian styled' (the cheaper ones are a bit small though, but that is inherent to Venice I guess). Service: the people at reception are really very kind and truly genuine. All in all, I can really recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Within 36 hours of returning home, we`d booked to go again...”
Reviews.Author: Pat-and-Maria
Reviews.Content: So oppulent and beautifully hidden away, but close enough to walk to "tourist attractions" We`ve been visiting Italy for many years, but this was our first time in Venezia. Meandering down the narrow little streets trying to find this hotel was a lot of fun!!! The chap with the beautiful eyes on reception was so welcoming, informative, and "molto sympatico" . (Doesn`t translate well into English, but you get what I mean?!!!) And then we were taken to our room. WOW. I can honestly say it was one of the most luxuriously decorated and sumptuous rooms we have ever stayed in. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff, and our wedding anniversary was acknowledged suitably !!! Breakfast was adequate, nothing too fancy, and the public rooms are splendid; in a simple kind of way, but that`s as negative as I can get. Totally fell in love with this hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmont
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best service of any hotel in Europe that I have ever stayed at. When checking in the front desk clerk showed me up to my hotel and explained everything in the room and around the area to me. I don't think I've ever had someone show me to my room before. The rooms are beautiful and everything looked brand new. The bed and room was large although the bathroom was a little small. Location is great as it's about a 10 minute walk from the train station, 15 minutes or so to Rialto. Everything was top notch and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarryBond007
Reviews.Content: The room was 5 star and the service too. The biggest room with the most luxurious decor. I couldn't find anything negative about this Hotel and would and have been recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Gidi B
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in Al Duca di Venezia for 5 nights. We had a superior double room. Hotel is located in a quite place, but short walking distance from Rialto anf from Piazzale Roma. Room was great. A big room (much bigger than what you typically get in euroean hotels), very nicely decorated, and very nice bathroom. Everything is new and looks very nice and clean. Breakfast was typical (you can order any type of eggs for extra cost). Hotel manager (I think that her name is Caterina) was so nice and helpfull. She gave us very good advices, and was very very friendly. We will come again

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Venetian Splendor”
Reviews.Author: riddett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a delight--absolutely gorgeous. My room was shades of cream and gold. Rich but not overpowering. It was a good size with a large bed and a large closet. I looked out on a little courtyard. The bathroom was marble with a bidet and heated rails for the towels which were in the same colors as the rest of the room. Everything was immaculate and in excellent condition. Breakfast was fine and the service was impeccable.The staff went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable and it really was an outstanding experience. Molto bene!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MLOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week. The hotel staff at the reception (Carlo & Christina) were more than willing to help us enjoy our visit to Venice. Apparently the building was originally built in the 15th century and was just renovated this year (2010). Our room was spacious and very clean, and our bed was quite comfortable. It is one stop vaporetto ride from the train station. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. MLOttawa

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the "mix up with our room"”
Reviews.Author: Diddy_Wee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, the rooms beautifully decorated, spacious and very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was great for us, as it was quiet, but at the same time an easy walk to St Mark's Sq, or the Vaporetto, and there are a couple of nice restaurants in the area (avoid Captains Cabin though!). The only negative aspect of our stay was that on arrival we were told that there had been a "problem with the system" and that despite booking in May, we would be in a downstairs room next to reception for the first two nights, then move to a better room for the last two nights. We were assured that the room downstairs was a superior double, but having been moved upstairs to Room 104, I'm pretty sure Room 01 is a classic double. It was a shame to put a dampener on what was a lovely trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AChristmas67
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t fault anything about this hotel â€“ the staff are friendly and helpful; the room (101) is dramatically decorated, clean, comfortable and very quiet, with a nice view of the museum next door; the breakfast is fine and plentiful; and the location is great if you donâ€™t want to be in the middle of all the hub-bub but do want easy access to everywhere. Itâ€™s about 30 seconds from San Stae vaporetto stop, just straight up the road, which is handy for the airport (we got one of those semi-private water taxi thingys, not sure what they call them but it dropped us right at San Stae stop) and for everywhere else. About one minuteâ€™s walk away is a nice little square with a few restaurants and bars on it where you can watch the locals go about their daily lives. If you donâ€™t want to use the vaporetto itâ€™s also easy to walk everywhere else â€“ and even if a particular area is a little bit far away, thereâ€™s plenty to take â€˜photos of along the way, so itâ€™s not a hassle! ï�Š I would definitely stay here again. I am just so happy to find a hotel where there is nothing to disappoint! ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Place to be in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LodiSingapore
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice and reached the hotel (through flooded street) safely. The hotel was not big from its external appearance but fantastic once we were inside: warm welcome by hotel staff, great room arrangement, spontaneous tour guide and above all the surrounding was so quiet! We were allocated rooms at the top level. There were only TWO rooms there. And they were superb! The hotel is far better than what we perceived on the photos, and deserve to be promoted better. It is not close from the hotspots for tourists. But being a small city, it took us less than 30 minutes to reach Piazza San Marco. And along the way, there were so many small boutiques which were so unique to Venice, so no time lost. All in all, please book your next stay in Venice with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BornTooLoose
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in Venice overall and rejoiced that vicissitudes reduced our visit from two days to one--it's smelly, congested, and overpriced, and most of the shops sell Carnival kitsch and other such merchandise. The Casino is pretty vulgar. But this hotel stands out for us as the best part of our visit--secluded, very friendly, over-the-top decor, nice breakfast, plenty of advice and assistance (especially from Caterina and her son). And we remain grateful for such an oasis in a desert of taste.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPeters
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel you are searching for. Very nice personel, very pretty hotel and so a very nice stay. We were here with two children (8) en (14) in a familyroom. Wifi worked very well. Left a big tip for the cleaninglady.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectation”
Reviews.Author: jferri
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our italian journey celebrating our 10 yr anniversary. Had the pleasure of staying six nights - three nights to begin our trip and three nights to end. The overall hotel experience was outstanding. Despite getting one of the smaller superior rooms upon arrival we were surprised with a beautiful and spacious superior room when we returned, although we reserved a classic room. The hotel is beautifully restored palace. The renovations and finishes are top of the line. The staff was kind, helpful and accomodating (this is not a given when travelling in Italy). The breakfast was typical, but we really enjoyed the freshly baked brioche. This was our third trip to Venice. When we return we will be staying at this hotel. There is no better value in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, attentive and friendly staff with impressive rooms”
Reviews.Author: stevenaflynn
Reviews.Content: Venice is a small place and most things are within easy reach of each other and this hotel which is close to the canal is convenient to reach everything. I was particularly impressed with the staff which were made me feel welcome after a long trip. Very clean and definitely worth asking for the white room!

Reviews.Title: “We experienced a wonderful Venetian ambiance at Hotel al Duca di Venezia”
Reviews.Author: keenandressage
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the north side of the island and right off the main canal. It is directly behind the Museum of Natural History. The water taxi dropped us off from the airport and it was less than 1/2 a block to the front door. We took the Red Family room that is pictured on their site and it was really lovely. Our girls (11 and 14) thought it was magical. The bathroom is newly renovated and very clean and functional. The hotel is very quiet and it is easy to get where you want to go either by Vaparetto or walking. Breakfast included freshly baked pastries that hit you by nose before you are fully awake......YUM! Good service, helpful staff and free internet. Loved our stay here and loved Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding..Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: coastal6107
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. In a two-week trip through Italy which included some very pretty places, this was absolutely our favorite. It is a renovated duke's palace, open since May 2010 & they did an outstanding job of it, with upholstered walls, spacious glamorous bathroom, a marvelously comfortable bed, Venetian chandelier, and large rooms. Ours had a sofa, a desk, a king bed, & another table. Service was excellent; we got tips on where to go & how to get there. It was in a neighborhood, out of the way of the Rialto/St Mark's bustle, so it was very quiet at night. We ate one breakfast there, which was good but not included in price of stay & wasn't anything out of the ordinary. We were able to order an omelette though. Wonderful places to eat right around there, or take a water taxi anywhere. Can't say enough about this hotel, it was just incredibly beautiful & in the perfect location for us. We didn't do any business things so not sure if there is a computer for our use. I don't recall if they have wi-fi. Parking not an issue since cars are not allowed in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS”
Reviews.Author: trinitymills
Reviews.Content: We were here to celebrate my birthday. We stayed in a superior room which was HUGE with a large full bathroom -- both a rarity in Europe. The room was very baroque and romantic -- yeah over the top, but don't you expect -- and want -- that in Venice? The room was always clean and in beautiful condition. My only complaint is that being on the top floor it got a little stuffy at night and although the windows opened, this time of year is bad for gnats (and I am bug bait). The staff was helpful with directions, concert tickets and restaurant reservations. The location is quiet, peaceful, far enough away from the tourist areas for a good rest, but close enough to get to everything easily. We ate breakfast in the hotel one day. It was OK, but there are so many wonderful pastry shops in the area with huge selections and outside cafe tables for people watching that we opted to eat out most days. There are many neighborhood restaurants nearby and a lovely square for sitting and watching the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service - like staying with family”
Reviews.Author: Mcmeekin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Duca's rooms were decorated in a Venetian style, beautiful. The area is a little quieter but only 5 min walk to the Rialto Bridge. The manager Caterina was fantastic. She was very helpful and extremely courteous, we felt like family!!! Thankyou Caterina we loved Venice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was absolutely gorgeous and I would highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: bartlett47
Reviews.Content: The room was sensational, the staff absolutely wonderful. It was within walking distance to everything. Close to a ferry station and had great little restaurants nearby. It is slightly away from the mad tourist central, thank goodness. I am definitely going back. We were celebrating my sisters 50th birthday and the staff sent us to a lovely restaurant, I felt safe and secure everywhere and the hotel certainly helped. It is a little hard to find, but if you pay attention to the directions,its not hard.

Reviews.Title: “amazing small hotel”
Reviews.Author: secondsister23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel central to everything but in a quiet area, staff were fantastic and Caterina welcomed us with open arms. Very clean and spacious rooms. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. My sisters and I will definitely be back. 5 star hotel for sure. Thanks Caterina

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjm31
Reviews.Content: As others have said - lovely little hotel, gorgeous, comfortable rooms. Breakfast small but adequate. Conveniently located in Santa Croce, which is close to the train station while still being fairly close to San Marco/Rialto without too much hustle-and-bustle. Warnings: owner/manager, though nice, does try to steer you in a much more expensive direction than you might be expecting, recommending very expensive/touristy restaurant in San Marco (which, once I actually checked the place out, did not seem to be as good as the more local/authentic restaurants nearby in Santa Croce), also trying to sell little ceramic things to us from the hotel lobby (at inflated prices). So all in all, as long as you graciously decline all the recommendations and go with Tripadvisor or just your gut by walking around, you'll love this place. It's gorgeous, it's a good value, and well-located.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hist0ry101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March for almost a week. It was a great location from which to explore the city. As it was (only slightly) further away from the main attractions it was very affordable and offered a luxurious, truly Venetian base for our holiday. Our room was small but absolutely beautiful. The hotel was clean, safe, romantic and near shops and restaurants.The staff were beyond helpful, not only concerning themselves with our stay in the hotel but with our enjoyment of the city as well. Overall, it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with spacey rooms in perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Rossenbos
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location is also important for hotels! This hotel offers very spacey rooms ( unlike most in Venice) and is situated only 2 minutes walk from the hussle and bussle of the Rialto part of Venice, but at the same time situated in a very calm and relaxed area. In other words: the nights are quiet, but access to the high life is instant. On top of that, this hotel offers very spacey rooms in the classic Venezian style. Service is superb, good knowleable staff with a wonderful command of the English language. Tremendous service, good solid breakfast, wireless internet and very good coffee. What more does one want? One tip: to reach the hotel from the parking, you can walk or take the waterbus. Don't consider walking!! Take the waterbus. 6 euro p.p but well spent money. This hotel will go onto my shortlist and when I'm in Venice, I will stay here. No question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nina018
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews of other guests. We were not disappointed! The hotel is easy to find if you take the directions given on the hotel website. The hotel is situated in a very quiet part of the town which becomes a very welcome change from the crowds in the other parts of Venice. It is about 15 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge and another 10 minutes onto St Marks Square. We were given a Superior room at the front of the hotel which was tastefully decorated in cream and gold and made to resemble a vintage style. The breakfast was adequate but became a bit monotonous after a couple of days. The service was great and the reception staff were very willing to give recommendations for sight seeing and where to eat. Eating by the major sights in Venice can prove to be very expensive. We found some great restaurants by the hotel which served great food and had a more local atmosphere. We would recommend La Zucca ( you have to book beforehand for both evening meal and lunch) and Capitan Uncino. Both are very close to the Hotel. We would definitely recommend staying here and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “3.5 out of 5 ...Meh, good value for $”
Reviews.Author: revengeofaone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok for the price. It's a place to sleep and have some breakfast. Location is ok. 10-15 min walk from piazzale roma if you don't get lost. Whereever you go in venice you will get lost. Take vaporetto to Riva del Biasio or the next stop. Once you have the hotel's map, it makes things easier. Our room was small. We had a window. The bathroom had a shower in the corner with a curtain. No tub. Breakfast was ok. Nothing special in my opinion. The hotel is about 10 min walk to Rialto market. About double or so to San Marco. The traghetto across to the Ghetto area was never operating so don't rely on it on your map. Overall, we loved Venice but not because of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “peace & quiet in venice - very nice hotel with a comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: brngrp
Reviews.Content: Venice in September is an absolute madhouse - at least in the big tourist areas. This hotel is away from them, but only 1/2 block from the Grand Canal, midway between two vaparetto stops. It's mainly a residential area, so this very nice hotel and comfortable bed gave us a wonderful, quiet night's sleep. GREAT pizzaria (Alforna) about 1/4 mile away (but ask directions - maze of narrow streets). Like almost all hotels in Venice, the decor was a bit "over-the-top", but more tasteful than most. Also, roomier than we expected. Our relatives stayed in a room for 4 (2 double beds), and were quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “tremendous value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cornishman66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated for frequent trains into Venice which are priced at just 1.80euro each way per person. The room we had was plenty large enough, had air conditioning, (a must in summer months), and was generally very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and the staff extremely friendly. Having been told how expensive Venice is, I thought at first that the rate quoted for 4 nights was the night rate and was very pleasantly surprised to find it was the rate for bed and breakfast for the 4 nights. Excellent value for money, I would recommend this hotel. BUT, ask for one of the quiet rooms on the side of the hotel. The rooms adjacent to the Square to the front of the hotel are affected by noise from the bar in the same Square.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, interesting experience”
Reviews.Author: AndyJaffrey
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in Venice, this hotel is in a perfect location, walking distance from the station and great if you arrive at Piazza Roma too. It's also very close to a Vaporetto stop if you arrive through Marco Polo. Santa Croc was a lovely location too, much nicer than the other side of the canal. Some really good restaurants nearby, and not the typical tourist traps. Muro Venezia is nearby and excellent quality food and service and an amazing 2 euro cover charge and no service included in the bill, a 1/2 litre of their house wine is about 7 Euros. I found it hard to walk past on my way to Rialto. La Zucca is also very close and we tried to get a last minute reservation but failed, but it was always busy with local traffic. We had the red room that is on the website home page, it's very 'venetian' and opulent but not to my taste, it did grow on me as the Prosecco flowed though. The staff were largely pleasant, but seemed under pressure a lot of the time. There was a heated exchange going on when we arrived, it did not stop when we tried to check in. Whilst the service was efficient it was a little uncomfortable, but maybe that is British reserve coming in to contact with Italian spirit :) We got given a map when we arrived and were shown their recommendations for dinner. We were also offered a Murano glass 'tour' by water taxi. I felt, but may be wrong, that these trips were stock recommendations and no effort was made to understand our specific requirements. We didn't make use of the recommendations. In the morning the guy at check in helps set up Breakfast and another breakfast helper was helping clean the rooms later. Everybody was multi tasking this weekend, perhaps there was a staffing issue. Sometimes the door is locked when you return, remember the door bell it took my a while to find! I would recommend this hotel, location is perfect, rooms are kept spotlessly clean and I enjoyed what the immediate area had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Super find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cultory
Reviews.Content: If you want a five star experience in a three star hotel, go there. Fantastic staff, high class materials in classic design, the hotel situated in a calm area away from the busy parts of the city but still in comfortable walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly and helpful stafff - a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jharcourt
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend in Venice with my now fiancee and stayed at this hotel. The staff helped me to find a brilliant resturuant (Bistro De Venise), organized flowers and champagne for our room and took care of a gondola booking. They were friendly, attentive and generally amazing. The supreme room I booked was great, the bed super comfortable and the bathrooms very good! The hotel is not that hard to find from the "Riva de Basio" stop on the Grand Canal, at most its a 10 min walk. Staying here made our special weekend away even more special. Highly reccommended!! *Only fault I can think of is my MacBook didn't work with internet in the room, something to do with Bootcamp and their firewall software. But they have a laptop in reception where you can access the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: viclic
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decoration, very romantic. The room was huge and comfortable. Quite location out of the messy touristic main area but still only one station away from the Ferrovia (Train station). Internet works very well. Definitely recommend if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Sightseeing in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mrokro
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very comfortable hotel in a quiet side-street, but only 5 walking-minutes to the next vaporetto-station on Canal Grande. The rooms are stylish and are are a great add-on to the Venice experinece. The maintenance of the whole hotel is surely above standards. Nice and very helpful staff. As there was a problem with the room booked we were offered a great up-grade free of any additional charge!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: valSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: This is a small, lovely, cozy hotel opened in March 2010. The staff, lead by Caterina - the hotel manager - is very pleasant and competent. Reservations were easy to be done through email, Carlo and Pratik answered all the infos we needed. We travelled with our teen age son and stayed in room 101. The hotel has an elevator for carrying up the lugage. The room was spacious, very nice decorated in Venezian style, exactly as shown in the hotel website. Nice and clean bathroom. From our room we could see the street and the Museum of Natural History The location was close to all the main tourist attractions in a nice and peaceful neighborhood. Our rate included continental breakfast which was delicious. Wireless internet was included in the rate and worked with no problems. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay there again on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- good location”
Reviews.Author: roy79
Reviews.Content: Lovely small newly renovated hotel with clean room in a quiet neighborhood which suited us perfectly. The rooms had a classic decorations made it felt very special comparing to standard hotel room. The hotel can be easily accessed by 15min walk from Rialto bridge (airport link) or 5min from the St. Stae stop.There is a Traghetto (â‚¬ 0.5) crossing just next to the hotel, which we recommend to try.
